imdb.title: RahXephon
imdb.plot: Kamina Ayato lives an ordinary life. He goes to school. He lives with his mother. He has schoolmates. But all of that changes one day when massive machines, known as the Dolem, attack the city of Tokyo with their destructive vocal...

episodes.title: First Movement: Invasion of the Capital/Overlord
episodes.plot: Ayato is just a normal teenager until there is an attack on Tokyo.

episodes.title: Second Movement: God and Man Awaken/Awakening
episodes.plot: Ayato gains insight into Reika's enigmatic nature.

episodes.title: Third Movement: City of Two/Welcome to Our Town
episodes.plot: In the RahXephon, Ayato got a shock because he lost Reika and saw Maya shedding blue blood. He then operates the RahXephon to crush one Dolem, and goes outside through the barrier with the female pursuer, Haruka. She later tells him that a spherical barrier has been covering Tokyo, which called Tokyo Jupiter, and implies that the time passes more slowly in the barrier than outside.

episodes.title: Fourth Movement: His Own Watch/Watch the Year Hand
episodes.plot: Ayato is tested to see if he is Mulian.

episodes.title: Fifth Movement: Nirai-Kanai/On Earth as It Is in Heaven
episodes.plot: Ayato is taken to his new home.

episodes.title: Sixth Movement: Disappearing City/Lost Songs Forgotten Memories
episodes.plot: Director Watari, Commander Kunugi, and the advisor Makoto Isshiki attend a press conference, leaving Souichi in charge of it. Kim takes offense at Ayato for his thoughtless remarks, which makes him serious about the MU issue.

episodes.title: Seventh Movement: The Day of Gathering/Phantom in the Cloud
episodes.plot: Elvy tries to take on a Dolem on his own.

episodes.title: Eighth Movement: The Holy Freezing Night/The Dreaming Stone
episodes.plot: They prepare a Christmas gift to someone special. Dr. Kisaragi finds a crystal stone on a broken Dolem that Ayato defeated, he gives it to Sayoko as a gift for the purpose of observing what happens.

episodes.title: Ninth Movement: The Shrine of Time/Sanctuary
episodes.plot: Futagami investigates what happened to the island. Quon leads Ayato to a small shrine after they saw a vision of Raika. Dr. Kisaragi tries to launch the RahXephon with Sayoko and Makoto.

episodes.title: Tenth Movement: Sonata of Recollection/War in the Remembrance
episodes.plot: Kunugi's departed daughter's composition proves to have strange qualities.

episodes.title: Eleventh Movement: Ellusive Circuit/Nightmare
episodes.plot: The Dolem catches Ayato with the RahXephon during the battle, and takes him into a nightmare.

episodes.title: Twelfth Movement: The Black Egg/Resonance
episodes.plot: Quon has fallen into a strange catatonic state and is hospitalized. But then to everyone's surprise, she suddenly vanishes, and the search is on to find out just where it is that she went.

episodes.title: Thirteenth Movement: First Human Specimen/Sleeping Beauty
episodes.plot: The question that seems to be on everyone's mind is just who Quon really is. Itsuki claims that she is his sister, but other things are coming to light that prove that may very well be a lie.

episodes.title: Fourteenth Movement: The Boy in the Mirror/Time After Time
episodes.plot: A shake up at the base takes place when the corporate interests use their influence to take charge of Quon. A new Terra weapon, The Vermillion, debuts and it's made known that The Foundation granted TERRA it's use.

episodes.title: Fifteenth Movement: The Night of the Children/Child Hood's End
episodes.plot: The present becomes the past as the focus shifts to the Bahbem Foundation. Three young children live there as students, but Isshiki has found a Dolem living in the ruins beneath the mansion and wants to protect it.

episodes.title: Sixteenth Movement: Another Person's Island/The Moon Princess
episodes.plot: Haruka asks her uncle about his daughter, Maya. Quon prepares to leave the TERRA. Ayato suffers for his identity. Megumi notices that Souichi and Kim have a close relationship.

episodes.title: Seventeenth Movement: Return to the Maze/Ground Zero
episodes.plot: TERRA sends Elvy to catch Ayato and Quon, as well as bring back the RahXephon. Though returning to Tokyo Jupiter may have seemed like a fantastic idea, Ayato quickly learns that much has changed.

episodes.title: Eighteenth Movement: Bond of Blue Blood/The Memory of a Lost City
episodes.plot: Ayato's life is falling apart. It seems that his only salvation is with Hiroko, and together the two decide to leave the Mu infested Tokyo and return to the safety of the real world.

episodes.title: Nineteenth Movement: Blue Friend/Ticket to Nowhere
episodes.plot: Megumi and Elvy make it back to the Vermillion but the RahXephon has been lost due to a magnetic storm.

episodes.title: Twentieth Movement: The Battle of the One Who Controls/Interested Parties
episodes.plot: Ayato returns to TERRA and finds out Isshiki has take over the command and they have a new cadet that resembles Reika.

episodes.title: Twenty-First Movement: The Mark of Xephon/Good Bye My Friend
episodes.plot: Makoto presents the Operation Downfall, which breaks the Tokyo Jupiter's barrier. Ayato's words and actions unintentionally disturb Dr. Kisaragi and Sayoko more than ever before. Mamoru sees Hiroko's face in Megumi, but he tries to take advantage of her as his revenge to Ayato.

episodes.title: Twenty-Second Movement: Mission Jupiter Annihilation/Down Fall
episodes.plot: Issihiki receives an order to cancel operation Downfall but ignores it.

episodes.title: Twenty-Third Movement: Eternity from Here/Where the Sweet Bird Song
episodes.plot: Ayato comes to terms with everything that has happened to him and by doing so regains his past.

episodes.title: Twenty-Fourth Movement: The Door to Tuning/Twin Music
episodes.plot: Futagami shows up as Jumonji from Federation Division 6 and orders Lilia Litvyak and the other TERRA ships to unload the evacuees and join the Federation forces.

episodes.title: Twenty-Fifth Movement: God's Uncertain Sound/Deus Ex Machina
episodes.plot: The remaining TERRA forces use the TDD unit on Elvy's plane to destroy much of the Mulian units.

episodes.title: Final Movement: Deep Away Into Infinity/Time Enough for Love
episodes.plot: With their godlike powers, Ayato and Quon travel through the spiritual world while adjusting the real world. He finally remembers his past with Haruka during the trip. What future will they choose?
